p.font: Today saw the launch of the new daily newspaper 'The UK Today'. According to the paper's editor, Charles Moody, 'The UK Today' is aimed at a younger twenty-something and is expected to reach an average of 200,000 in its first year.

Although the paper is in format, Moody was quick to point out that it will have as much serious news as any of the . One of its most striking features is its highly unusual . Articles aren't laid out in but in boxes, each accompanied by a colour photograph.
You'll find all the usual sections - national and international news, financial news, arts and entertainment, sport and, of course, advertisements.
So, what's in today's ? Well, on the , under the eye-catching banner 'More hot air?' is an in-depth on the outcomes of this week's international summit meeting on global warming. Well worth a read!

Tomorrow television in the south-east will be able to tune into Barnston TV. The new cable hopes to attract as wide an audience as possible with extensive of both national and local news as well as all major sporting events.

Football matches will be broadcast both mid-week and at weekends and these are expected to boost significantly. Other will include a late-night chat show, which will be in front of a audience and aired on Saturday evenings.

Funding will be generated through advertising. A 60-second will cost considerably less on Barnston TV than on national television and there is expected to be a huge demand for airtime from local businesses.
